iron age artefacts discovered in park .
work begins to construct festive ice rink .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live coverage on this page has now ended for monday but some news , sport and travel updates will be posted overnight .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: weather : a chilly evening with rain around
text: some showers overnight and it 'll be fairly breezy too .
it 'll be a cold night with lows of about 2c ( 37f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: bravery award after marina rescue
text: watch the moment sarah cunnington gets a bravery award after saving 91-year-old dennis oates from drowning at mercia marina .

documents.title: hollywood actors become hos patrons
text: hollywood actor stephen graham , star of films including this is england and the damned united , has become a patron of a leicestershire hos
mr graham , alongside his wife hannah walters , who is also an actor , accepted roles as patrons for loros hos after visiting earlier this month .
the pair , who appeared together in pirates of the carribean , live in ibstock and have so far raised £ 2,346 via bucket collections for the hos
`` we drive past loros at least once a week , '' mr graham said .
`` it 's great to be able to support a local organisation which is right on our doorstep . ''
loros hos provides specialist palliative care in leicester , leicestershire and rutland .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wife murderer jailed for 'horrendous , brutal ' attack
text: a man has been jailed for life for murdering his wife .
paul sherratt , 57 , attacked his wife jane , 60 , at their home in spondon in january before calling the police .
he had also injured himself and the pair were taken to hospital where jane was treated for serious head injuries .
sherratt , of avondale road , was discharged shortly after the attack and he was arrested and charged with attempted murder .
the charge became murder after jane died in hospital in may .
police said it was a `` horrendous , brutal , sustained '' and `` unprovoked '' attack .
`` even though paul did contact the emergency services , this was hours after the assault and he offered jane no aid as she lay severely injured , '' det sgt lesley smith said .
sherratt was sentenced to life with a minimum tariff of 16 years at nottingham crown court today after pleading guilty earlier this month .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : crash on a38
text: delays # a38 northbound between coxbench and ripley .
3 vehicle rtc .
lane one closed with 2 immobile vehicles and debris .
recovery en-route .
minor injuries only .
avoid route if possible .
# highways
you guys need a medal you do not get enough recognition well done guys and girls
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: janner family 'tried to remove 30 accusers from inquiry '
text: legal teams for the family of the late lord janner have failed in an attempt to have most of the participants removed from a national inquiry into allegations against him .
the independent inquiry into child sexual abuse is set to investigate how institutions dealt with allegations against the former leicester mp , who died in december 2015 .
but it has emerged , in august , legal representatives for the remaining janner family asked that 30 of the 33 individual core participants in the inquiry had their status removed .
they claimed the individuals made allegations after the inquiry was set up and so were not relevant to it .
professor​ ​alexis​ ​jay​ , who 's chairing the inquiry , has refused the request .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester political reporter

documents.title: royal wedding : 'small fund ' available for street parties
text: time to get the bunting out .
the mayor of erewash , mary hopkinson , has offered her `` sincere congratulations '' to prince harry and meghan markle who have announced their engagement today .
the derbyshire council has also confirmed it 's going to make a `` small fund '' available for street parties to celebrate the royal wedding next spring .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester 's croft announces retirement
text: leicester 's croft announces retirement

documents.title: puel : tottenham match 'a good challenge '
text: leicester city manager claude puel has reported no fresh injury concerns ahead of tuesday 's visit of tottenham .
long-term absentees robert huth and matty james are the only players unavailable to the frenchman .
puel said : `` we must try to play our own game and it will be good to see our progress under pressure against a good opponent .
`` it 's a good challenge for us . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: selby takes confidence from 2016 triumph
text: selby takes confidence from 2016 triumph
author: Owen Phillips
BBC Sport

documents.title: 'do n't let brexit end culture city hopes '
text: 'do n't let brexit end culture city hopes '

documents.title: nottingham mps sign capital of culture complaint
text: all three of nottingham 's mps are among a group which has written to the head of the eu commission to complain about brexit scuppering the uk 's entries for european capital of culture .
the cross-party group represents areas that have submitted bids for the 2023 title , namely nottingham , leeds , milton keynes , dundee and a joint belfast-londonderry-strabane bid .
they said it was `` inexplicable '' the eu waited for bids to be submitted before revealing they were all ineligible .
the eu says it is a `` concrete consequence '' of brexit that the uk ca n't host the 2023 culture capital .
signatories of the group , led by mp rachel reeves , include all of nottingham 's members : labour 's lilian greenwood , alex norris and chris leslie .
other non-eu countries have hosted european capital of culture .
the uk should n't miss out just because of brexit .
i 've written to juncker and the culture secretary to call for urgent action .
oh come on .
you 're better than this .
read the criteria and then withdraw the letter - and complain to @ twitterid # stopbrexit # fbpe
the criteria are a legal document , and as any legal document could be amended .
if both parties want it
just because we are british ?
and european ?
fair point .
but in practice , does it not amount to asking the eu to change one of its regulations so that a country that has signalled its intention to leave the union may still enjoy one of its benefits ?
should the only relationship between uk and eu in the future be the financial/trade one ?
if the uk gov makes progress in december the way to include culture in negotiations will be open .
if not .
not .
but for now it is too early to resign .
remaining is the best outcome .
short of that , eea/efta .
but if the uk fails to secure either , then i am afraid we will be heading down the canada path .
otherwise this will be a case of having our cake and eat it .
i do not support `` eat and have '' .
i support `` wait and see '' ( how the negotiations are going in december ) instead of `` cancel immediately ''
your tweet is misleading .
capital of culture is for eu mss , efta/eea countries , candidate countries & potential candidates for eu membership .
uk is none of all those after 2021 .
please stop cherry- & look at the rules .
what ?
they are in eea .
stop moaning .
out is out
it 's a lost cause @ twitterid we 're just not as cool as the @ twitterid suggests !
# leeds2023fail
you might not be cool ; ) but it is not lost until dcms who announced the competition will close/re-brand it .
it ai n't gon na happen so live with it !
# failleeds2023
wow .
you really think leeds is not cool .
i 'm sure you will get a nice letter back from mr junker , a polite its those nasty brexiteers fault so off
tbh hull has it this year so it 's not like it means anything
great work @ twitterid my ex mp postivity will prevail and politics should not get in the way of uk holding european capital of culture .
sending all the luck and hope in the world .
# leeds2023
aiden , it 's a scheme dreamt up by the eu , sponsored by the eu and paid for by the eu .
do you think this is the time for the uk to say : we 're walking from the eu , efta , eea , ecj , ema , eba , single market but we 'd still like some of your money to promote our cities ?
and you also seem anti brexit you should also be encouraging this
encouraging what ?
shameless hypocrisy ?
no thanks .
even the anti brexiteers do n't want brexit now make up your mind
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: elderly man dies in six-vehicle crash
text: an elderly man has died following a crash involving six vehicles on the a4304 near lubenham this morning .
the crash occurred at about 11:10 this morning .
area traffic contol leicestershire said the road is expected to remain closed for `` some time '' .
police want to speak to anyone who saw a red toyota corolla travelling on the a4304 towards market harborough at that time .
the man is yet to be formally identified .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: plain clothes officers arrest drug dealing suspects
text: this is the moment plain clothes police officers arrested a man and woman in ilkeston for suspected drug dealing .
derbyshire police said community intelligence led to the arrests in stamford street on friday .
they said they found what they believe to be class a drugs .
a 45-year-old man from langley mill has since been charged with possession of a class a drug with intent to supply .
he 's due to appear at southern derbyshire magistrates ' court on friday , december 22 .
the 27-year-old woman was released pending further investigation .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wonky christmas tree 'to be straightened '
text: recent strong winds are to blame for beeston 's wonky christmas tree , the council has said .
a broxtowe borough council spokesman said the foundations were designed to be flexible which is why the tree in broadgate park has gone `` a bit askew '' .
apparently other councils have had similar problems `` and in some instances their trees have snapped '' .
a contractor is on their way to straighten the tree in time for the christmas lights switch-on this saturday , he said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pictures released after woman makes racist comments
text: do you recognise this woman ?
police want to speak to her after a woman was recorded making racist comments towards members of the public and taxi drivers in leicester .
it happened in horsefair street at the beginning of september but leicestershire police has only just released these images .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man dies following a52 crash
text: a man has died following a two-vehicle collision in leicestershire .
the crash , in which a woman also suffered serious injuries , happened on the a52 bottesford bypass at around 17:40 on sunday .
it involved a black audi and a black ford ka .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: vending machine to supply homeless
text: vending machine to supply homeless

documents.title: soldiers 'attending 999 ambulance calls '
text: soldiers based in rutland are the first in the uk to provide a voluntary medical response service for civilians .
the troops , based at kendrew barracks in cottesmore , support east midlands ambulance service as first responders to some 999 calls .
wo lee pearce , said : `` the soldiers get a reward by getting to go out in the community and engaging .
`` the skillset they get [ from being first responders ] , they can take into exercises and combat operations . ''
the collaboration between kendrew barracks and east midlands ambulance service has been running for two years .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: group 's bid to restore 'tolkien station '
text: volunteers are bidding to restore and refurbish a disused railway station , that they say was used by hobbit and lord of the rings author j.r.r .
tolkien .
gedling village preservation society would like to turn the station , that closed in 1960 , into a community space and heritage centre .
volunteers believe tolkien and his aunt , jane neave , used the station from 1911-22 .
the station was also used by miners travelling to gedling colliery and holidaymakers heading to skegness .
the group has said its bid to restore the station has support from nottinghamshire county council 's historic buildings officer and that heritage lottery east midlands could provide funding .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: have you seen this stethoscope ?
text: felix hay , from leicester royal infirmary , removed his littmann cardiology iv stethoscope so as not to harm a baby during a blood test .
after rushing off to get the test results , he came back in to the room to find it was gone .
he said the special piece of kit , which went missing on 16 november , was very good at up subtle cardiac sounds often missed by other stethoscopes .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: beeston 's wonky christmas tree returns for 2017
text: it would n't be christmas in this nottinghamshire town without a tree that looks as if it 's had one too many eggnogs .
this is beeston 's festive fir which , like last year 's effort ( below ) , is n't quite upright .
last year broxtowe borough council went out to broadgate park and straightened it up .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

the couple will be getting married in spring 2018 , clarence house announced earlier .
congratulations to his royal highness and ms markle .

documents.title: your fiery skies
text: there were some beautiful , dramatic colours in the sky over the east midlands at sunset yesterday .
here 's draycott , derbyshire .

author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'exceptional ' iron age finds discovered in park
text: a collection of iron age metal artefacts , which experts believe sheds light on feasting rituals among prehistoric communities , has been uncovered .
the discovery , in glenfield park , leicestershire , includes 11 complete , or near complete cauldrons and a third century brooch ( below ) .
the team from the university of leicester , who carried out the excavation , believe the cauldrons highlight the role of the area as a potential host site for feasting .

john thomas , from the university of leicester , said : `` glenfield park is an exceptional archaeological site , with a fantastic array of finds that highlight this as one of the more important discoveries of recent years . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : engineers scale heights of abraham cable car
text: ever wondered what it takes to look after a cable car ?
the maintenance team at the heights of abraham in matlock bath have just begun their annual winter safety testing programme .
at the attraction 's highest point , engineers have to climb up to 90 metres in the air .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : pietersen savages jake ball after brisbane loss
text: england should drop jake ball for the second test in adelaide , according to four-time ashes winner kevin pietersen .
nottinghamshire seamer , ball , 26 , struggled in england 's 10-wicket defeat in brisbane , finishing with match figures of 1-115 .
`` is jake ball any good ? ''
pietersen told bt sport .
`` i do n't think so , not at this level in australia from what i have seen , especially with the hype leading into this test match about him having to play .
`` i would n't play ball in the next test match , absolutely no chance .
i 'd play mason crane , i know it 's under lights but it 's that variation of a leg-spin bowler . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: city council tory leader dies
text: nottingham city councillor , georgina culley , has died aged 65 .
ms culley was also the leader of the conservative group and served the wollaton ward for over 25 years .
she died suddenly on saturday evening and workmates have been paying tribute to `` a respected and valued colleague '' who was a `` huge support '' to them .
very sad to announce the passing of cllr georgina culley .
our thoughts are with her family and friends at this sad time .
as soon as we receive confirmation of funeral arrangements we will update the federation membership accordingly .
author: Lisa Teanby
Newsreader, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: prince harry and meghan to live in nottingham cottage
text: you 'll have no doubt heard the news today that prince harry is to marry his american actress girlfriend meghan markle .
it 's also been announced the pair are to live in nottingham cottage at kensington palace .
but what is the building 's connection to a city in the east midlands ?
it goes way back to 1619 when a recently built two-storey mansion in the village of kensington was bought by the earl of nottingham , who named it nottingham house .
the earl 's son became secretary of state to king william iii who , with his wife queen mary ii , bought the building from him in 1689 .
the king enlisted sir christopher wren to extend and improve the house , which was renamed kensington palace .
it was the favoured residence of successive monarchs until the death of george ii in 1760 and continued to be used afterwards - queen victoria was born and brought up there .
nottingham cottage ( known as `` nott cott '' ) was designed by wren and is a cosy two-bedroom property , which references the palace 's original name .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'so-called big players let stags down '
text: 'so-called big players let stags down '

documents.title: in snowfall in peak district
text: there was the first significant snowfall of this winter across the peak district this weekend .
here are some of the bbc weather watcher photos from in and around buxton .
there was also snowfall in places like castleton and glossop .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: city and tigers stars support rainbow laces campaign
text: leicester 's two major sports teams showed their support for lgbt charity stonewall 's rainbow laces campaign this weekend .
wes morgan wore a special multi-coloured captain 's armband during their 1-1 draw with west ham and some city and tigers players wore rainbow laces .
the laces were also given out to supporters at welford road .
stonewall 's rainbow laces campaign is all about promoting sport as inclusive for all and making lgbt fans and players feel welcome and accepted .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'forest need to play with more guile '
text: 'forest need to play with more guile '

documents.title: 150-year-old pistol handed in to police
text: this rusted , double-barrel pin fire pistol , dating back to the 1860s or 70s has been handed in to derbyshire police .
it was one of about 180 guns handed to the force during the two-week national firearms surrender , which ended last night .
a world war two sub-machine gun and several shotguns , rifles and pistols were also surrendered .
elsewhere in the east midlands , nottinghamshire police said last week it had had more than 130 weapons handed in , including this shotgun disguised as a walking stick .
in leicestershire , more than 50 weapons and 600 rounds of ammunition were surrendered .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work starts on leicester 's festive ice rink
text: work has begun in leicester to construct a temporary ice rink .
the rink , which opens on saturday 9 december , is part of the city 's christmas offering alongside the big wheel in jubilee square .
it will remain open until monday 8 january 2018 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man , 70 , robbed of holiday cash
text: do you recognise this man ?
police have released these images after a 70-year-old man was robbed on his way to the travel agent in derby .
a man barged into him and knocked him to the ground before stealing a bag containing cash he was planning to change for a holiday .
the robber then ran off along east street and onto st peter 's street .
it happened at about 16:15 on tuesday october 17 .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football club rescues fans stranded in leicestershire
text: a football club paid a £ 2,000 taxi bill after fans were left stranded at donington park services on saturday .
between 40 and 50 watford supporters were stuck at the m1 service station in leicestershire , about 170 miles from the game against newcastle at st james ' park , after their coach broke down .
they arrived in time for kick-off and were rewarded with a 3-0 victory .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rise in people visiting market harborough 's shops
text: there has been a rise in the number of people visiting market harborough 's high street , new figures reveal .
statistics compiled by footfall counters show 44,099 people visited in october , up from 33,016 in february 2017 .
eric keal , who runs a gift shop in the town , believes social media has helped bring people to the high street .
`` facebook is really good for comments , costs and people wanting to know where we are , '' he told bbc radio leicester .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : three-vehicle crash on a38
text: watch out for delays on the a38 southbound this morning after a crash involving three vehicles .
this is how it 's looking near alfreton .
no-one was injured in the crash , which happened at about 06:20 , but the vehicles were badly damaged and there is a large amount of debris to be cleared .
the carriageway between the watchorn island and ripley is n't closed but it is taking people time to negotiate their way past the scene , a derbyshire police spokeswoman said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'brave ' toddler dies from liver cancer
text: some very sad news from over the weekend .
a two-year-old , from sutton-in-ashfield , whose family raised more than £ 350,000 to try to save him from a rare form of liver cancer , has died .
dawson willcock 's parents had raised the money for specialist treatment in america but were later told it would n't save him .
the money is instead being used for research and a retreat for cancer patients in skegness .
in a post on facebook , wendy and david willcock said : `` the bravest little boy we ever knew [ has ] left for a better place .
`` our hearts are broken and only being held together by pride , love and admiration for the child we brought in to this world and cuddled as he left . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hs2 'will increase nottingham-derby journey times '
text: some rail journeys between derby and nottingham are expected to take almost 15 minutes longer because of hs2 , according to documents seen by the bbc .
the official hs2 ltd publication show trains between the cities will have to stop at toton before reversing out , which involves the driver having to change cab
toton is due to become a regional hub on the high speed network .

chris williamson , the mp for derby north , said : `` we ca n't have a situation where we invest all this money in the railway station in derby , billions of pounds on hs2 , to actually see an inferior service .
`` that really would be a crackpot proposition . ''
hs2 ltd said its project will `` deliver major benefits by dramatically improving journey times between the midlands , the north and london '' .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby political reporter

documents.title: welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to monday across the east midlands .
dave wade and i will be with you until later with the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live
